{{BLP sources|date=September 2017}} {{Infobox musical artist <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Musicians --> | name = Tim Hawkins | image = Tim Hawkins.jpg | caption = Tim Hawkins in 2008 | image_size = | background = solo_singer | Birth_name = Timothy Aaron Hawkins | birth_date = {{birth date and age|mf=yes|1968|3|30}} | occupation = [[Singer]], [[songwriter]], [[comedian]] | years_active = 2002–present | label = | website = {{URL|timhawkins.net}} }} '''Timothy Aaron "Tim" Hawkins''' (born March 30, 1968) is an American [[Christian]] [[comedian]], [[songwriter]], and [[singer]], best known for parodying popular songs such as [[Carrie Underwood]]'s "[[Jesus, Take The Wheel]]", [[Kansas (band)|Kansas]]'s "[[Dust in the Wind]]", and "[[The Candy Man]]", along with stand-up material based on topics such as marriage, [[homeschooling]], and parenting.<ref name=news>{{cite web |last=Krieg |first=Sheryl |title=Tim Hawkins finds the funny in everyday living |url=http://www.news-sentinel.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/20121003/ENT/310039988/1009/LIVING |work=[[The News-Sentinel]] |accessdate=November 3, 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141103025007/http://www.news-sentinel.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=%2F20121003%2FENT%2F310039988%2F1009%2FLIVING |archivedate=November 3, 2014 |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.montgomeryadvertiser.com/story/entertainment/2017/07/11/tims-take-share-some-laughs-hawkins-mpac/467623001/|title=Tim's take: Share some laughs with Hawkins at MPAC|publisher=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.modbee.com/entertainment/article78395562.html|title=Tim Hawkins brings good, clean fun to Gallo Center|publisher=}}</ref> Hawkins has released five CDs and nine DVDs since 2002. Hawkins began to release his comedy on the Internet, with his videos gaining more than 200 million views on [[YouTube]], [[GodTube]], and [[Facebook]] as of early 2013.<ref name=crosswalk>{{cite web|last=Hatcher|first=Lori|title=Tim Hawkins - Homeschooling Is Something to Laugh About|url=http://www.crosswalk.com/family/homeschool/encouragement/tim-hawkins-homeschooling-is-something-to-laugh-about.html|website=[[Crosswalk.com]]|publisher=[[Salem Web Network]]|accessdate=November 3, 2014}}</ref>
Tim has one brother, Todd Hawkins, who is also his stage manager. He married his wife Heather in 1993 and they have four children (three boys and a girl – Spencer, Olivia, Levi, and Jack), in [[St. Charles, Missouri]].<ref name="crosswalk" /> He played baseball as an outfielder for the [[University of Missouri]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mutigers.com/sports/m-basebl/spec-rel/062105aah.html|title=Missouri Baseball History|accessdate=July 24, 2015|publisher=[[Missouri Tigers]]}}</ref> He is a cousin of [[Freight Mabrey]].<ref>{{cite podcast |host=Tim Hawkins|title=Poddy Break 053 - The Crew - Plivates, Ultraman, and Cannibals |website=timhawkins.net/pages/poddy-break |date=2 March 2017 |url=https://poddybreak.libsyn.com/053-the-crew-plivates-ultraman-and-cannibals |access-date=29 June 2017}}</ref>
==Discography== ===DVDs=== *Full Range of Motion (2006) *I'm No Rockstar (2008) *Insanitized (2010) *Rock Show Comedy Tour (with Bob Smiley & John Branyan) (2011) *Push Pull Point Pow (2012) *Greatest Hits & Greatest Bits (2013) *That's the Worst (2014) *Just About Enough (2016)
===CDs=== *Tuna Fish Sandwich (2002) *Extremely Madeover (2004) *Cletus Take the Reel (2009) *Pretty Pink Tractor (2010) *Rockshow Comedy Tour (2011)
